Reviews.Title: “Cheap, cheerful and delivers what it promises!”
Reviews.Author: James666_12
Reviews.Content: Myself and my girlfriends dad booked to stay at this hotel for one night on a short weekend trip to Amsterdam. Firstly, we were on a budget and were not looking for anything luxury, just a place to sleep. If you want to stay in the heart of Amsterdam, in a basic, clean and comfortable room then this hotel is perfect! When you come to Amsterdam for only two days you should be out sight seeing...not sitting in your hotel room watching T.V! Before booking you should be aware that it literally is on the red light district and it is noisy. Not in periods, not in short bursts, CONSTANT noise as the red light district starts to get busy at night, right through to about six in the morning. For us this didn't matter, as after a long day of travelling and sight seeing we were able to sleep through this. It is one of those scenarios; common sense is to realise it is on the red light district, you know it before you go, do not whinge about the noise when you get there. Had a straight forward check in process, walked in to the bar, got the key and paid. Each time you want to leave the room you hand the key back to the bar maid and request it upon your arrival. Simple. The room isn't fantastic but you get what you pay for. Beds were quite low, a bit like a futon, but comfy enough. Really suprised when we got there and found that it wasn't shared bathroom and shower facilities, you get a key for your own bathroom as well which was literally two steps across the corridor from our room. REALLY steep stairs..... I would say if you are disabled or have any problems with mobility this hotel is not for you. Overall, the above disadvantages didn't bother us in the slightest. It really depends on the person and their circumstances but if I go on a similar trip to Amsterdam again I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of red lights district”
Reviews.Author: savvikos
Reviews.Content: A chip solution in the heart of Red Lights District

Reviews.Title: “An absolute bargain in the heart of Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: PascalS22
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located for visiting Amsterdam. Whilst basic, my hotel room looked exactly like the picture on the website (there have been some reviews stating otherwise). I stayed in a single room, so maybe the variations in room may exist for doubles. The staff at the reception area in the Pub were always were friendly and helpful. Although, like some other reviewers Iâ€™m still not sure how the security worksâ€¦you request the keys to a particular room number and whoever is behind the bar hands it over.... often the staff would changeâ€¦so how could they verify that they were giving the key to the right person? There is so much to do in this area and everything seemed to be a short walk away. It is in the heart of the red light district with many canals and restaurants very close by. I arrived from the main train station and walked to the hotel in around 10 â€“ 15 minutes. Whilst there is a lot of noise and action outside the hotel, I could hardly hear anything from my room. The steps to the rooms are very narrow and steepâ€¦not a huge issue for me, but would require careful attention if carrying full size luggage. When you consider the location, tidiness of the rooms, and friendliness of the staff for the price charged, this hotel is an absolute bargain. When next in Amsterdam, I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: VodkaQueenLeicester
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location for this hotel, in the Red Light District. Basic room, which was good for the price. Website is slightly misleading as it says the rooms are provided with a shower and a toilet - my room had shared facilities. You need to leave a 20 euro deposit for the remote control for the TV, but I didn't want to watch TV, so didn't bother. Steps are extremely steep, so bear this in mind if you have trouble with stairs. Didn't have breakfast here, so can't comment. But if you are looking for a nice, clean, comfy room for a basic price, look no further!

Reviews.Title: “Value one star hotel”
Reviews.Author: beap1
Reviews.Content: Central, clean & quiet (at least it was two floors up, at the back). Bang in middle of Red Light District and 5 mins walk from station.

Reviews.Title: “much better available in same area for better price”
Reviews.Author: jackherer30
Reviews.Content: rooms were disgusting bar has a shady undercurrent staff were ok didn't have Breakfast here so can't comment on that but i can't imagine it bein all that nice.torenzicht is a better option on the same canal

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing room (misleading website photos) - Good location”
Reviews.Author: sarah01shop
Reviews.Content: Easy to find to hotel - right in the heart of the red light district. I was looking forward to the 70's inspired room as seen on there website but unfortunately it didnt meet my expectations. Our room was very basic and had not been decorated for years -and was nothing like the photos. The room overlooked the main street which was noisy until the early hours but wasnt a problem for us as it added to the atmosphere ! We felt that the room was expensive for what we got (Â£75 with no breakfast) I would recommend that you research well before opting for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bar with a hotel”
Reviews.Author: oicelemmij
Reviews.Content: This is a bar with eleven?? hotel rooms upstairs. All four reviews are correct. You check in with a lady behind the bar. She was nice and helpful. Very steep steps. One luggage per person & use the handrail to be safe. Single bed room was tiny by US standards, huge by Tokyo standards. Basic sleep accommodation, Euro type low sitting bed. bare desk, hotel, one lamp, a wind-up clock that needed to be wound, clothes closet. Bathroom vent was loud. High water pressure, very hot water. Comfortably heated, regulated by opening the window. Barred window had ugly view of roofs. Window bars probably a good idea since I might climb out the window to get on the roof. Since I'm in the middle of the RLD, I expected city sounds. Got the expected ones, and none of the unexpected, thank goodness... sirens, woman shouting/fighting in street, church bells ringing, distant car horns, street sounds, etc. Have to leave key with bar each time you leave. Very quiet in dawn/early morning. Street & hotel construction ongoing. Paid 55 euro for Sunday night stay. Would I spend that on this hotel again... possibly. Amsterdam is a great city. But I think I'm ready to stay in other parts of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Not as advertised, very over priced.”
Reviews.Author: jchunt
Reviews.Content: Very over priced at â‚¬60 per night considering breakfast is not included either (it says breakfast included on their website but it's not available) the view out of the bar window has changed from being red light windows to fashion dummies, now they have closed the windows opposite. it's a bit lifeless in this area compared to what it used to be. i wouldn't stay again or recommend for anything other than stag parties etc just wanting basic accomodation. their website needs updating as it is false advertising at present.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Spot for Red Light District”
Reviews.Author: vinaish
Reviews.Content: Me and three buddies stayed at the Royal Taste Hotel in amsterdam and it was great. the hotel is three blocks from the main Dam Square and three blocks from the train station. its located right in the heart of the RLD. linked to many canals with restaurants and bars, the royal taste is a perfect spot for a group that needs an inexpensive hotel to pretty much crash at... Nice spot, the owners are super nice and helped us around the city...

Reviews.Title: “hotel royal taste amstedam”
Reviews.Author: ndnhrdy
Reviews.Content: set in the heart of the red light amidst all the bars and night life, the hotel offers value for money, we have stayed there for the past seven years, around twice if not three times a year, the rooms are basic but clean, what more do you need, in amsterdam you really should not be spending much time in your room. bar is open tyill late. we are very good friends with the staff, in fact two of the came over for our wedding. would not stay anywhere else in the dam, the hotel is a great base. Back again at the begining of march with husband and at the end of march with the girls.

HotelInfo.Name: Royal Taste Hotel Amsterdam
HotelInfo.Address: Oudezijds Achterburgwal 47, Amsterdam 6443 CE, The Netherlands
